name: Divani Meteora Hotel

reviews.text: Very nice hotel with helpful and friendly staff. The food was a little better than some of our other hotels but typically Greek. We stayed as a party of 12 in 4 hotels during this trip. This hotel was one of the better ones with two nice swimming pools and other service like a spa but at extra cost.
reviews.title: Very Nice Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel as part of a tour group. The dinner and breakfast had some variety but not nearly as good as the Divani Caravel in Athens just to give some comparison within the Divani offerings. The rooms were nice but the bathroom felt tiny. Wifi was not included which was surprising. The most annoying thing was the TV had limited channels and many of them would run for about 3 or so minutes before asking for 24 euros to be able to watch the channel for the next 24 hours. We had no intention of using any channel for 24 hours, maybe 1-2 hours max. We're there to see the monasteries, not be surcharged for a little downtime in the room before we go to sleep. We had no interaction with the staff so I can't comment on service as our arrangements were all handled by the tour. Our room faced the mountain cliffs behind the hotel but most of the view was blocked by another part of the hotel building itself. This was room 231 I think, so avoid 31 on any floor I would recommend. Rooms on either side of us were not as blocked from the view. All in all, a good place to stay comfortably in the area but no perks here.
reviews.title: Good proximity to the monasteries of Meteora, small bathroom

reviews.text: Stayed in this hotel as part of my 4 Days 3 Night Classical Greece Tour with G.O Tours.
reviews.title: Decent for 1 night stay but will not to return

reviews.text: Room is big and clean. Bed was soft and squeaky. We asked for a double bed but it was 2 single beds put side by side. Air conditioner seems to work at only 1 temperature - 25 degrees. Tried adjusting and it went off.
reviews.title: Worst hotel on tour - horrible service - nickle & dime guests!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: No free wifi, not even at the lobby.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.text: Great place. Ambience and interior of the hotel is beautifyl! pPerfect view of the monasteries at Meteora from the hotel room. Convenient as its just a stone throw away from the town. Very good breakfast and dinner buffet spread!
reviews.title: Great place!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was enjoyable... Lovely pool, nice room, good bathroom. Bed was a little uncomfortable, but not anything major. Dinner and Breakfast were good, and the staff was nice.
reviews.title: Enjoyable Stay

reviews.text: One complaint - WiFi access is €5.00 for 24 hours. I bought it, but it would not work at all during the evening - I got maybe 1o minutes in the AM just before leaving. Staff wouldn't refund this despite my complaint. I know it's only €5 but still, having to pay for something that doesn't work is very annoying
reviews.title: 4 star with a great meteora view
Brilliant location in stunning Meteora
reviews.text: Stayed here while we toured meteora. Nice and fresh rooms, hearty breakfast and perfect view of those magnificent rocks. I was happy with the service. only downside was there was no free internet. Not sure about the price as I was on a tour.

We stayed here as part of a tour and were lucky enough to have a room with views to the monasteries, really stunning. Our room was clean and comfortable, the food the usual average buffet for dinner and good range for breakfast. It was one of few hotels with no free wifi. It's in town so easy to walk around. A visit to Meteora is a must, well recommended.
reviews.title: One Night stay
Average 3.5-star property
reviews.text: Pros

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - Good location at Kalambaka
reviews.title: Very Good Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - Some rooms with views of the monasteries and mountains
reviews.title: It's OK

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Cons
reviews.title: Divani Hotel- Kalambaka, Greece

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - TV were still the large CRT types
reviews.title: Good location

reviews.text: This a lovely hotel, everything feels first class, rooms and facilities are very clean and functional. It is only a 5 minute stroll up to the main shopping area which has everything you need.
reviews.title: great place to stay below Metetora monastries

reviews.text: Hotel was very nice, very clean rooms with view of Meteora monasteries, nice big outdoor pool. Indoor pool, spa, gym and stuff looked average and required money, which was not worth it. 5 euros for 24 hours of internet service in the room via ethernet cable. There was also wifi. Great location, right on the main road as you enter Kalambaka. Great breakfast.
reviews.title: Great location, good service!

reviews.text: we (I and my teenagers) stayed in this hotel during our tour. we had a triple room very nice view to the front and very nice bathroom. around the corner we were walking to the centre of Kalambaka. The swimmingpool was ok, breakfast and dinner were served in buffet style. the hotel was luxury and the staff very friendly and helpfull to us. good hotel for just 1 night.
reviews.title: good hotel for 1 night sleep suitable for sightseeingtrips

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for one night as part of a mainland Greece land tour of Ancient sites. This hotel was lovely. Very modern, clean and very comfortable bedrooms and good food in the restaurant for breakfast and dinner.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel - great facilities and comfortable rooms

reviews.text: Reception, bar and lounges all furnished to high standard; rooms have internet and wifi is available in reception.
reviews.title: Very pleased with this hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our group stayed overnight during a tour of Greece. Next morning we went to Meteora Monasteries. Our room was tired, with the undersides of the chairs all ripped, bathroom showed its age etc, nothing like the Divani Caravelle where we stayed in Greece the previous night. However it served its purpose, we were all fed, watered and had an ok sleep before visiting the monasteries in the morning.
reviews.title: Good for one night stop o re

reviews.text: It is a nice hotel, clean, good service, good breakfast. The price was a good value for the level of the hotel. Hotel has also a nice swimming pool that you can enjoy after visiting the Meteore sites. SPA is also available but is not free of charge.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, perfect location to visit Meteore

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It might be the best choice for the town/location as it is on the edge of town, but within easy walking distance.Didn't use the outdoor pool, but it looked nice.
reviews.title: It's a Motel 6 for group/bus tour travellers

reviews.text: Our room had a view of the one monastry you can see from town. They had faux grass mats on the little balcony that should have been cleaned and had seen better days. A large part of the view was taken up by the wall of the other wing of the hotel. Beds were lumpy and the buffet substandard. Both trays with pasta were only 1/4 full and had the 'been sitting there for a long time' look. In addition the warm food was all room temperature. Beakfast didn't impress either. Cold eggs and the meat dished looked highly processes. Beaklfast 6 sausages were mini hot dogs, to each his own. and then there is the nickel and diming on wifi etc.
reviews.title: Not thrilled, lots of extra charges

reviews.text: This hotel claims to be 4 Star, first class. First thing: Wifi is not free. It's 5€ for each device! And the wifi is horrible anyways! Dont pay! It's a waste of your money. Also, There's no free TV, it's only movies and each is 12€. And every time you pick up your phone, prepare to pay at least a euro. In my room and in the lobby's restroom and main lobby, I saw ANTS crawling all over. Loads of them!! Also, the door to the balcony broke off the hinges. I'm aware that it's supposed to be an easily unattached door but it would not re-attach for anything! The location was decent as you could walk to shops and such. But that's about it.
reviews.title: Great hotel for the Meteora region

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After a long day of travel, and many days sleeping on rock-hard European beds, my husband and I were overly thrilled at the like-home luxury this hotel provided. The beds were soft and pillows fluffy, the room was larger than most we'd stayed in so far, and it was extremely clean. Breakfast was a nice bonus, and it was a pretty decent spread. The monestaries are also only a short drive away.
reviews.title: Clean, Luxury Hotel - But so-so staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The one thing that bothered us, is that the next day we were traveling to Olympia, and needed to check the address of our hotel. Being that we didn't have Internet access on our phones, we wanted to simply use the Internet at the hotel for a few short minutes to plan our trip for the next day. There was a computer in the general lobby/lounge area of the hotel, but it appeared that it wasn't working (wouldn't turn on). When I approached the woman at the main desk to ask if there was a problem with the computer and explained that it had no power, she impatiently explained to me that it cost 5 Euro to use it for one hour and turned away. I explained why we needed to use it, and she didn't offer to help me locate the address of our next destination - her attitude was really "pay me the 5 Euro or move on," which, as you can imagine, soured the experience a bit (considering that the hotel is on the expensive side, it seemed a bit nit-picky to me).
reviews.title: Fantastic Views

reviews.text: Also, the hotel seems to serve many tours, and there were several large groups staying at the hotel that night, but we weren't bothered by any noise or any other type of disturbance.
reviews.title: I was disappointed

reviews.text: Overall, the stay was good - and I had the best night's sleep I had in a while on a SOFT bed! :-)
reviews.title: what about wifi?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for a weekend in Kalambaka, and chose this hotel mainly for its location and good reviews. Our room was facing the Meteora rocks, so the view all the time was fantastic. The room was spacious as well as the bathroom. Buffet breakfast had a good selection, and prices for dinner were reasonable and servings were generous. The staff were friendly, polite and helpful. Only downside was no free internet or wifi in the rooms.
reviews.title: Good hotel to stay at

reviews.text: This was my first stay here. When you open your drapes---the view that greets you is literally breathtaking. Gorgeous mountain range surrounded by incredible sky. The hotel itself is built into rock and off in the distance is a view of the world famous mt. ranges that are home to an order of monks.
reviews.title: A hotel that will literally take your breath away"

reviews.text: The hotel is european chic ---beautifully decorated.
reviews.title: Great Base for Meteora Sightseeing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The artwork adorning the walls is art show worthy.
reviews.title: Ok for Business - a bit uninspiring for holiday

reviews.text: The hotel has every amenity yet has a small hotel feel.
reviews.title: Worth considering if visiting Meteora in summer with children

reviews.text: One restaurant that served one menu--family style. The food was good but not excellent.
reviews.title: Not thrilled with our stay.

reviews.text: Bus package saw us here for 1 night. Dinner & breakfast included but as others have said not much variety in the food choices. Maybe as this was our last stop we were a bit jaded & tired. Wifi is now free but pool & gym are still extras.
reviews.title: OK

reviews.text: Room was large & clean with a nice balcony with a view over the valley. Easy walk into main parts of town with plenty of shopping & meal options.
reviews.title: Very good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is well located. Nice breakfast and dinner but no real varieties. Room was clean. The mountain view was amazing and they another view which is the rocks of metoroa view. The strange thing that we asked for tissues and thy didn't have it in the hotel. The shower water pressure is fair but not that strong. I think the hotel over priced compared to other hotels in the area . I still recommend it
reviews.title: Nice rooms, but too many extra charges

reviews.text: We spent a night here before going to Meteora. The hotel is clean and well located, with a big pool, however there were a few things we didn't like about it. There was no WIFI available, only a desktop computer by the front desk, which was five euro an hour. It also cost extra to use the indoor pool and the gym, which is something we haven't come across before. There were no towels by the pool, which was located by the entrance / parking area - I found this a bit odd as we were walking around in swimsuits while people were arriving. It also took a couple of people in our group a while to be served drinks from the bar. Dinner and breakfast were okay, with quite a bit of variety. The rooms were nice and we slept very well, although our bed was two singles pushed together.
reviews.title: Nice 4 star hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My family and I stayed in Divani for a day. Rooms were clean, nice big pool. Service was efficient considering the hotel was full. We checked in pretty fast considering the lobby full of people of a group waiting for their keys. Breakfast was assorted with something for every taste. I had a back room with a wonderful view. I recommend those rooms.
reviews.title: Very nice

description: Divani Meteora Hotel is situated next to the iconic rocks of Meteora, in the charming village of Kalambaka. The hotel boasts modern design, renovated facilities and a breathtaking view of the surrounding landscape. 165 deluxe rooms await you with subtle fabric designs, oak furnishings, spacious sitting lounges and verandas. Guests can relax by the outdoor pool, or try the hotel spa featuring sauna, steam bath, Jacuzzi and a fitness centre.
